column1: Pernicious anemia is a type of vitamin B12 anemia.
You get this vitamin from eating foods such as meat, poultry, shellfish, eggs, and dairy products.
This protein is released by cells in the stomach.
Or they cannot properly absorb vitamin B12 in the small intestine.
Some people do not have symptoms.
Symptoms can include: - Confusion - Depression - Loss of balance - Numbness and tingling in the hands and feet
The doctor or nurse will perform a physical exam.
- Some patients may also need to take vitamin B12 supplements by mouth.
People with pernicious anemia may have gastric polyps.
A woman with low B12 levels may have a false positive Pap smear.
Call your health care provider if you have symptoms of vitamin B12 deficiency.
